intro: Satyria clonantha, commonly known as the clustered rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Satyria clonantha produces small yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by long, slender pods containing seeds.
